description: Scammers targeted elderly individuals on dating websites, pretending to be loving partners before requesting money for fake medical emergencies or travel expenses.
Seniors given pop up adds that, after clicking, gives them a virus.
Seniors contacted by phone or email with a message they have won the lottery but need to pay taxes to claim prize
Emails pretending to be from Medicare or Social Security tricked seniors into providing personal and financial information, leading to identity theft.
Fraudsters used fake email addresses mimicking trusted institutions to deceive seniors into making unauthorized bank transfers or sharing sensitive information.
Scammers tricked elderly sellers by sending fraudulent checks for purchases and requesting a refund of the overpaid amount before the check bounced.
